meanings.definition: Relating to or caused by interference.
meanings.sent1: The interferential waves disrupted the radio signal.
meanings.sent2: The interferential noise from the construction site made it hard to concentrate.
meanings.sent3: The interferential static on the TV sounded like a robot trying to communicate.
meanings.sent4: The interferential clash of opinions created tension in the room.
meanings.sent5: The interferential feedback loop caused the system to malfunction.

meanings.sent1: The interferential signals from the two devices overlapped and caused a malfunction.
meanings.sent2: The interferential patterns in the data indicated a problem with the transmission.
meanings.sent3: The interferential mix-up of schedules led to a comical misunderstanding.
meanings.sent4: The interferential dance of the fireflies lit up the night sky.
meanings.sent5: The interferential interference disrupted the communication between the teams.

meanings.sent1: The interferential barrier blocked the path to the treasure.
meanings.sent2: The interferential cloud cover prevented the satellite from receiving signals.
meanings.sent3: The interferential squirrel kept stealing the bird's food, causing a funny chase.
meanings.sent4: The interferential wall between them made it hard to communicate effectively.
meanings.sent5: The interferential interference disrupted the peaceful atmosphere of the park.
